Repudiation.description: An attacker can pass data through the log to attack a log reader, and there's no documentation of what sorts of validation are done.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1562.002 - Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools

Repudiation.description: A low privilege attacker can read interesting security information in the logs.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1552.001 - Unsecured Credentials: Credentials in Files

Repudiation.description: An attacker can alter digital signatures because the digital signature system you're implementing is weak, or uses MACs where it should use a signature.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1553.002 - Subvert Trust Controls

Repudiation.description: An attacker can alter log messages on a network because they lack strong integrity controls.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1562.002 - Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools

Repudiation.description: An attacker can create a log entry without a timestamp (or no log entry is timestamped).
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1070.006 - Indicator Removal on Host: Timestomp

Repudiation.description: An attacker can make the logs wrap around and lose data.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1070.001 - Indicator Removal on Host: Clear Command History

Repudiation.description: An attacker can make a log lose or confuse security information.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1562.002 - Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools

Repudiation.description: An attacker can use a shared key to authenticate as different principals, confusing the information in the logs.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1078 - Valid Accounts

Repudiation.description: An attacker can get arbitrary data into logs from unauthenticated (or weakly authenticated) outsiders without validation.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1562.002 - Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools

Repudiation.description: An attacker can edit logs and there's no way to tell (perhaps because there's no heartbeat option for the logging system).
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1532 - Data Encrypted for Impact

Repudiation.description: An attacker can say 'I didn't do that,' and you'd have no way to prove them wrong.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1553.002 - Subvert Trust Controls

Repudiation.description: The system has no logs.
Repudiation.NIST 800-53: AU-1 (Audit and Accountability Policy and Procedures)
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1562.001 - Impair Defenses: Disable Logging

Repudiation.description: An attacker exploits weak audit trail protections to delete logs after executing unauthorized actions.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1485 - Data Destruction

Repudiation.description: A malicious insider modifies the configuration of audit logs to selectively omit certain actions they perform.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1222.001 - File and Directory Permissions Modification: Linux and Mac

Repudiation.description: An attacker uses spoofed IP addresses to generate misleading or false log entries, obscuring the source of the attack.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1078 - Valid Accounts

Repudiation.description: A malware infects the log management system to alter or corrupt logs to prevent forensic analysis.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1496 - Resource Hijacking

Repudiation.description: An attacker crafts inputs that cause the logging mechanism to crash, thus preventing logging of subsequent actions.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1499 - Endpoint Denial of Service

Repudiation.description: An attacker leverages race conditions to perform actions without leaving a trace in the logs by exploiting timing discrepancies in logging mechanisms.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1561.002 - Disk Wipe: Disk Structure Wipe

Repudiation.description: A user manipulates their client-side environment to prevent certain actions from being logged.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1550.003 - Subvert Trust Controls: Gatekeeper Bypass

Repudiation.description: An attacker bypasses application logging by using deprecated API calls not monitored by current logging mechanisms.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1497 - Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion

Repudiation.description: An attacker induces errors in logging by flooding the system with high volumes of actions, causing log entries to be dropped.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1499.001 - Network Denial of Service

Repudiation.description: An attacker modifies an application's code to disable log forwarding to central management systems, isolating the evidence of an attack to local devices.
Repudiation.MITRE ATT&CK: T1562.004 - Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify System Firewall
